history.content:
The new student enrollment system does not allow the department to limit who gets on the waitlist. 

At this point, the plan is to wait until after new major declarations are processed (after spring grades are reported) and then kick people who are not declared cs/eecs majors off the waitlist at that time.  (We won't be able to wait until appeals have been processed for students who are initially denied.)

This means that it makes sense for students who are taking their last pre-req this semester and are applying now to declare LSCS to waitlist upper division CS courses in phase I but not for anyone else who isn't already a declared cs/eecs major.

(It may take until up to tomorrow morning for the system to update but if you can't get on the waitlist Thursday morning, please let us know.)

The new student enrollment system does not allow the department to limit who gets on the waitlist. We haven't decided what to do in relationship to that fact but one option would be to kick all non-majors off the waitlist either every so often or near the end of phase 1 of enrollments. 

(It may take until up to tomorrow morning for the system to update but if you can't get on the waitlist Thursday morning, please let us know.)

The new student enrollment system does not allow the department to limit who gets on the waitlist. We haven't decided what to do in relationship to that fact but one option would be to kick all non-majors off the waitlist either every so often or near the end of phase 1 of enrollments.

children.subject: Students who are undeclared and are not about to declare at the end of this semester will not take space in the class ahead of cs/eecs declared majors who sign up later.
So I shouldn't be worried about using Phase I units on upper-div classes in fear of not being able to enroll due to other undeclared students being on the waitlist already?

At this point, the plan is to wait until after new major declarations are processed (after spring grades are reported) and then kick people who are not declared cs/eecs majors off the waitlist at that time.  (We won't be able to wait until appeals have been processed for students who are initially denied.)

This means that it makes sense for students who are taking their last pre-req this semester and are applying now to declare LSCS to waitlist upper division CS courses in phase I but not for anyone else who isn't already a declared cs/eecs major.

When will we know what you decide to do? I'm a CS minor so I would definitely use Phase I units on a CS upper div if that option was technically available to me, but if you kick off non majors periodically, then that would be a waste of Phase I units, right?

history.content: Saw some stuff on Facebook about this being possible, and I know this definitely wasn't the case in the past.
history.subject: Is it true that an undeclared CS major can use Phase I to get on the waitlists of upper-div classes?
